purpose.summary: This policy establishes corporate guidelines for payout caps and performance thresholds in all sales incentive compensation plans, ensuring financial predictability and budget management, fairness and consistency across divisions, prevention of windfall payouts, and motivation for minimum performance standards.
objectives: Ensure financial predictability and budget management
Maintain fairness and consistency across divisions
Establish motivation for minimum performance standards

appliesTo: All sales incentive compensation plans across all divisions unless explicitly exempted by the Compensation Review Board
exclusions: Plans explicitly exempted by the Compensation Review Board

definitions.definition: The minimum performance level required to earn any payout for a component or plan.
The maximum incentive payout regardless of performance level achieved.
Ratio calculated as (Base Salary + Maximum Possible Incentive) / Base Salary. Maximum leverage limit is 3.0x base salary.
The expected incentive payment at 100% quota attainment, used as the basis for cap calculations.
Unusually large payouts that may be reviewed even within cap limits, triggered when individual payout exceeds a threshold amount or exceeds 3x historical average.

provisions.title: Threshold Guidelines
provisions.content: Standard Threshold: 75% of quota. Performance below 75% of quota results in $0 payout. Performance at 75% of quota results in minimum payout (typically 50-75% pro-rata credit). Performance above 75% results in payout per plan curve.

subProvisions.title: Threshold Variations by Role
subProvisions.content: Recommended thresholds vary by role type:
items: Individual Contributors (IC): 75% of quota - Standard expectation
Sales Managers: 80% of quota - Higher accountability
Executives: 80-90% of quota - Strategic leadership requirement
New Hires (first year): 50-60% of quota - Ramp period accommodation

provisions.title: Individual Cap Guidelines
provisions.content: Standard Individual Cap: 200% of Target Incentive. Caps manage budget predictability, prevent excessive payouts from unusual events, align with market practices, and manage shareholder/board concerns.

subProvisions.title: Leverage Limits
subProvisions.content: Maximum Leverage: 3.0x base salary. Plans exceeding 3.0x leverage require executive approval.

subProvisions.title: Performance-Based Caps
subProvisions.content: Some plans may cap credit at a maximum attainment level rather than dollar amount. Example: No credit for performance above 150% of quota.

subProvisions.title: Budget Caps (Aggregate)
subProvisions.content: Division Budget Cap: Total incentive payout for a division may be capped at a percentage of division revenue or absolute dollar budget limit. If division reaches budget cap:
items: Individual payouts may be reduced pro-rata
Next year planning may be reviewed

provisions.title: Implementation Requirements
provisions.content: Requirements for properly implementing caps and thresholds in plan documentation and communication.

subProvisions.title: Plan Documentation
items: Explain the rationale for threshold and cap levels
Provide examples showing threshold and cap impact

subProvisions.title: Participant Communication
subProvisions.content: Plans with thresholds or caps must:
items: Answer FAQs about caps and thresholds

subProvisions.title: Manager Training
items: Be able to explain to their teams
Factor caps/thresholds into coaching and territory planning

provisions.title: Governance and Exceptions
provisions.content: Approval requirements for variances from standard cap and threshold guidelines.

tables.caption: Approval Requirements by Variance
rows: CFO + Comp Review Board (requires strong justification)

provisions.title: Market Benchmarking
provisions.content: Caps and thresholds are benchmarked annually against industry standards (medical/dental sales), role-specific market data, and peer company practices.

subProvisions.title: Adjustment Process
items: Review market data annually in Q4
Propose updates to guidelines if needed

provisions.title: Monitoring and Reporting
provisions.content: Regular monitoring to assess effectiveness of caps and thresholds.

subProvisions.title: Annual Analysis
items: Effectiveness of cap levels (too many hitting cap = consider adjustment)
Threshold impact (too many below = quota/plan design issue)

provisions.title: Special Circumstances
provisions.content: Provisions for handling windfall payouts, new products/markets, and guarantees.

subProvisions.title: Windfalls
subProvisions.content: Even within cap limits, unusually large payouts may be reviewed. Windfall Review Trigger: Individual payout exceeds threshold amount OR exceeds 3x historical average.
items: Determine if payout is earned vs. windfall (luck, one-time event, data error)
CRB may exercise discretion to adjust if windfall is unearned

subProvisions.title: New Products/Markets
subProvisions.content: Plans for new products or new markets may have:
items: Lower thresholds (or no threshold) during launch period
Sunset provisions (revert to standard guidelines after specified period)

subProvisions.title: Guarantees and Draws
subProvisions.content: For new hires or roles with guarantees:
items: Guarantees do not count toward cap calculations
Once guarantee period ends, standard caps apply
Draw recoveries are not subject to caps
